tiles.name: Snowy Peak Outskirts
tiles.description: Rocky terrain with patches of snow. Marks the outer edge of the village, leading towards higher, more treacherous peaks.

tiles.name: Mountain Path Junction
tiles.description: Where paths converge, connecting different parts of the village and leading up the mountain. Prayer flags adorn the trail.

tiles.name: Yak Hide Tents Area
tiles.description: A cluster of Yak Hide Tents. The nomadic dwellings of villagers that move from place to place.

tiles.name: Glacial River Source
tiles.description: The starting point of one of the glacial rivers, fed by melting snow from the higher peaks.

tiles.name: Central Prayer Wheel Plaza
tiles.description: The heart of the village, dominated by a large central prayer wheel. A hub for religious activity and social gatherings. The Kyzyl-Suu Monastery is nearby.

tiles.name: Stone House District
tiles.description: An area consisting of tightly packed stone houses, forming the more permanent residential part of the village.

tiles.name: Avalanche Zone Start
tiles.description: Marked with warning signs, this area is prone to avalanches from the snow-capped peaks above.

tiles.name: Kyzyl-Suu Monastery Outskirts
tiles.description: Stone houses surrounding the Kyzyl-Suu Monastery

tiles.name: Glacial River Crossing
tiles.description: A shallow section of the glacial river where villagers frequently cross. Stepping stones assist in traversing the icy water.
